intro: Fagotriticum, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers that resemble those of the true dandelion. The plant is native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Fagotriticum species are often used in traditional medicine and have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
